alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 01 at 4:42AM PDT until November 02 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches, except 3 to 9 inches above 7000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph with 80 to 100 mph gusts along the Sierra crest. * WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area. * WHEN...From noon today to 8 PM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. Lake Tahoe waters will be rough this afternoon with wave heights locally up to 5 feet. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will crash this afternoon with snow expected for all elevations. There will be an initial band of heavy wet snow pushing through this afternoon into the evening. This will be followed by periods of snow showers tonight through Wednesday. These showers may bring rapidly changing conditions with a quick 1 to 2 inches of accumulation possible.
info.instruction: Even light snowfall causes major travel delays, especially during periods of high traffic volume. Be sure to allow extra time to reach your destination. Leave extra space between vehicles since it takes longer to stop on slick roadways. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
